commit_message:
DNM: Add instance AZ filter for nova instances

The option `cross_az_attach` in nova gives the possibility
to disable cross az attachment of volume on nova vms.
What is missing is a cinder scheduler filter that uses the
instance AZ and filters the corresponding cinder AZs.

WiP / DO NOT MERGE

Change-Id: I3028dbdf08e9f0f815fdcd1796a23def6f328943
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/92/389592/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 SAP SE # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_utils import uuidutils from cinder.compute import nova from cinder import exception from cinder.i18n import _, _LW from cinder.scheduler import filters LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) HINT_KEYWORD = 'local_to_instance' INSTANCE_HOST_PROP = 'OS-EXT-AZ:availability_zone' REQUESTS_TIMEOUT = 5 class InstanceLocalityFilter(filters.BaseHostFilter): """Schedule volume on the same AZ as a given instance. This filter enables selection of a storage back-end located on the AZ where the instance's hypervisor is running. This provides data locality: the instance and the volume are located on the same physical machine. In order to work: - The Extended Server Attributes extension needs to be active in Nova (this is by default), so that the 'OS-EXT-AZ:availability_zone' property is returned when requesting instance info. - Either an account with privileged rights for Nova must be configured in Cinder configuration (see 'os_privileged_user_name'), or the user making the call needs to have sufficient rights (see 'extended_server_attributes' in Nova policy). """ def __init__(self): # Cache Nova API answers directly into the Filter object. # Since a BaseHostFilter instance lives only during the volume's # scheduling, the cache is re-created for every new volume creation. self._cache = {} super(InstanceLocalityFilter, self).__init__() def _nova_has_extended_server_attributes(self, context): """Check Extended Server Attributes presence Find out whether the Extended Server Attributes extension is activated in Nova or not. Cache the result to query Nova only once. """ if not hasattr(self, '_nova_ext_srv_attr'): self._nova_ext_srv_attr = nova.API().has_extension( context, 'ExtendedServerAttributes', timeout=REQUESTS_TIMEOUT) return self._nova_ext_srv_attr def host_passes(self, host_state, filter_properties): context = filter_properties['context'] az = host_state.service['availability_zone'] scheduler_hints = filter_properties.get('scheduler_hints') or {} instance_uuid = scheduler_hints.get(HINT_KEYWORD, None) # Without 'local_to_instance' hint if not instance_uuid: return True if not uuidutils.is_uuid_like(instance_uuid): raise exception.InvalidUUID(uuid=instance_uuid) # TODO(adrienverge): Currently it is not recommended to allow instance # migrations for hypervisors where this hint will be used. In case of # instance migration, a previously locally-created volume will not be # automatically migrated. Also in case of instance migration during the # volume's scheduling, the result is unpredictable. A future # enhancement would be to subscribe to Nova migration events (e.g. via # Ceilometer). # First, lookup for already-known information in local cache if instance_uuid in self._cache: return self._cache[instance_uuid] == az if not self._nova_has_extended_server_attributes(context): LOG.warning(_LW('Hint "%s" dropped because ' 'ExtendedServerAttributes not active in Nova.'), HINT_KEYWORD) raise exception.CinderException(_('Hint "%s" not supported.') % HINT_KEYWORD) server = nova.API().get_server(context, instance_uuid, privileged_user=True, timeout=REQUESTS_TIMEOUT) if not hasattr(server, INSTANCE_HOST_PROP): LOG.warning(_LW('Hint "%s" dropped because Nova did not return ' 'enough information. Either Nova policy needs to ' 'be changed or a privileged account for Nova ' 'should be specified in conf.'), HINT_KEYWORD) raise exception.CinderException(_('Hint "%s" not supported.') % HINT_KEYWORD) self._cache[instance_uuid] = getattr(server, INSTANCE_HOST_PROP) # Match if given instance is hosted on host return self._cache[instance_uuid] == az

commit_message:
Add volume existence check when we backup it

I think it has already completed the validation
check for container name. So I only add volume
existence check.

Change-Id: I2dce4e60a7b8f29b3c0498cb88c27d2793974a16

commit_message:
Adds snapshot based backups for Quobyte volumes

Adds local management of snapshot based backups similar to the lvm
implementation (code is based on this).
As Quobyte based Cinder volumes are files in a
shared Quobyte volume the driver can access the snapshots locally
similar to the lvm setup.
Also adds a corresponding unit test and a release note.

Implements: blueprint quobyte-snapshot-backup

Change-Id: I465a908d754cba9f9982a3224c9b86449fc69865

added_lines: import os_brickfrom oslo_config import cfgfrom oslo_utils import importutilsfrom cinder import dbfrom cinder.tests.unit import fake_constants as fakefrom cinder.tests.unit import utils as tests_utils from cinder import utils CONF = cfg.CONF self.volume = importutils.import_object(self.CONF.volume_manager) @mock.patch.object(utils, 'temporary_chown') @mock.patch('six.moves.builtins.open') @mock.patch.object(os_brick.initiator.connector, 'get_connector_properties') @mock.patch.object(db.sqlalchemy.api, 'volume_get') def test_backup_volume(self, mock_volume_get, mock_get_connector_properties, mock_file_open, mock_temporary_chown): vol = tests_utils.create_volume(self.context) self.context.user_id = fake.USER_ID self.context.project_id = fake.PROJECT_ID backup_obj = tests_utils.create_backup(self.context, vol['id']) properties = {} attach_info = {'device': {'path': '/dev/null'}} backup_service = mock.Mock() self.volume.driver._detach_volume = mock.MagicMock() self.volume.driver._attach_volume = mock.MagicMock() self.volume.driver.terminate_connection = mock.MagicMock() mock_volume_get.return_value = vol mock_get_connector_properties.return_value = properties f = mock_file_open.return_value = open('/dev/null', 'rb') backup_service.backup(backup_obj, f, None) self.volume.driver._attach_volume.return_value = attach_info self.volume.driver.backup_volume(self.context, backup_obj, backup_service) mock_volume_get.assert_called_with(self.context, vol['id'])

commit_message:
Fix snapshot update exception while creating cgsnapshot

Currently, self.db.snapshot_update is used to update the snapshot info
while creating cgsnapshot, but Snapshot object should be used instead.

Change-Id: Iaa801876b76d54fe3aa49f43b189ddee28963d14
Closes-Bug: #1599022

commit_message:
3PAR: concurrent request creates multiple issues

When a user wants to perform parallel cinder image volume
creation operation, 3par driver ends the execution up with
different errors in different test scenarios as described
in bug.

While creating image volumes concurrently on HPE 3PAR, one of the
step is to copy image to volume. And for this copy process, 3par
driver tries to establish connection between host and array. As
the volume creation requests are multiple and concurrent, multiple
requests are being issued for connection between host and array
which should be in sync to avoid deadlock errors.

Closes-Bug: #1658888

Change-Id: I6535ec139e09062248060f4692a721a352c091eb

commit_message:
Huawei: support for ipv6

Both ipv4 and ipv6 are supported by Huawei cinder driver when attaching
a volume to a VM.

Change-Id: I6fe6c2b226d3863c7eb91e76120d98a6230e0f42
Implements: blueprint ipv6-support

commit_message:
Fix storage pools key of Huawei driver

Storage pools key is incorrect while getting local/remote device of
Huawei driver, this patch changes it to the correct one.

Change-Id: Ic48c5a0ddfbec4b86e6dc62ad7d4b1a86db86f1c
Closes-Bug: #1635500

commit_message:
Converting string into JSON when cinder takes block_device_mapping value from DB

To reproduce this bug:
1. Boot an instance from a volume.
2. Create an image of this volume-backended instance using nova image-create.
3. Create a new volume using this image.
4. Boot a new instance using this newly created volume.
    -> then booting an instacne fails with the error message below
Invalid image metadata. Error: A list is required in field img_block_device_mapping, not a unicode (HTTP 400)

The cause of this bug is, when creating an image meta object, Cinder passes block_device_mapping value as string to Nova
but the value should be json.

Closes-Bug: #1476114
Change-Id: I6c70f61cc9fc9abc23a36cf33df2e4fc0273bcd4

commit_message:
Remove unused function _build_iscsi_target_name

This function is not used anywhere in the code.
With this function removed, there is no need for a
body for SanISCSIDriver.

Change-Id: Icea18ea98de980ba57d278c2e9512dcfb14ca425

commit_message:
db/sqlalchemy/api: delete in_use value

When the first consistencygroup is created for a new project in
cinder, reserved value can assign to in_use. Thereforce, in_use
value shouldn't be updated.

Change-Id: I77b760655f71e61fd9c299de2da3703f88872293
close-bug: 1693610

commit_message:
Enhance Infortrend driver

Features added:
- Protocol iSCSI supports both MPIO and MCS now.
- Improve Infortrend driver performance.
- Enhance extraspecs usage and refactor retype.
- Support for list manageable volume
- Support for list/manage/unmanage snapshot

Issues fixed:
- Errors for live migration with Infortrend backend.(#1481968)
- Manage-existing issues for using source-name.
- Creating volume on a wrong pool.

Co-Authored-By: billsung <billsung.taiwan@gmail.com>

Closes-bug: #1481968
Change-Id: I6e9d4c9e4637bf2a5e745f1b02006d5cc898807e

commit_message:
vzstorage: deprecate vzstorage_mount_options

These mount options has never passed to pstorage-mount.
Instead of that mount options should be defined in
shares config file.

Change-Id: Ibadcc88d228c8fd1862db8379f3646f393e7362a
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>

commit_message:
Support utf-8 decode

The decode format is not designed in wsgi _process_stack function,
which will cause exception when create volume with Chinese character.
This patch is to fix it.

Change-Id: I8030a83129810baf4b3a1e420152cf81e75ad0a0
Closes-Bug: #1703493

commit_message:
Support shared lock

Currently we protects create from volume/snapshot by using a
lock to protect the operation from concurrent deletes the
volumes/snapshot used in the create operation, but we use
exclusive locks on both delete and create side which will result
in only one create operations from the same volume/snapshot can
process on the same time.

Since Tooz has supported shared filelock, this patch gives a
optimized method, add exclusive(write) locks for delete
operations and shared(read) locks for create operations, so we
can create from volume/snapshot on parallel and also protect
create operations from concurrent delete the source
volume/snapshot.

It add a 'concurrent_create' config option because some arrays
don't support creating a couple of volumes from the same
volume/snapshot.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I78200911dac2a50d3375de63a4318077b276b0fd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/72/456072/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: active_locks = {} lock_ref = {} def acquire(self, blocking=True, shared=False): if self.name not in self.active_locks.keys(): self.active_locks[self.name] = shared self.lock_ref[self.name] = 1 return True elif (shared and self.active_locks[self.name]): self.lock_ref[self.name] += 1 self.lock_ref[self.name] -= 1 if not self.lock_ref[self.name]: self.active_locks.pop(self.name) self.assertNotIn(expected_name, MockToozLock.active_locks.keys()) with agent1.get_lock(lock_name): self.assertIn(expected_name, MockToozLock.active_locks.keys()) self.assertNotIn(expected_name, MockToozLock.active_locks.keys()) def test_coordinator_lock_shared(self, get_coordinator, heartbeat): crd = get_coordinator.return_value crd.get_lock.side_effect = lambda n: MockToozLock(n) agent1 = coordination.Coordinator() agent1.start() agent2 = coordination.Coordinator() agent2.start() lock_name = 'lock' expected_name = lock_name.encode('ascii') self.assertNotIn(expected_name, MockToozLock.active_locks.keys()) with agent1.get_lock(lock_name)(shared=True): self.assertIn(expected_name, MockToozLock.active_locks.keys()) self.assertTrue(agent1.get_lock(lock_name).acquire(shared=True)) self.assertTrue(agent2.get_lock(lock_name).acquire(shared=True)) agent1.get_lock(lock_name).release() agent2.get_lock(lock_name).release() self.assertNotIn(expected_name, MockToozLock.active_locks.keys())
deleted_lines: active_locks = set() def acquire(self, blocking=True): if self.name not in self.active_locks: self.active_locks.add(self.name) self.active_locks.remove(self.name) self.assertNotIn(expected_name, MockToozLock.active_locks) with agent1.get_lock(lock_name): self.assertIn(expected_name, MockToozLock.active_locks) self.assertNotIn(expected_name, MockToozLock.active_locks)

subject: CoprHD: Handle duplicate display naming error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-04 08:55:14.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/coprhd/common.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/c1b7a4fcaf87192bb50d3318d9942518b34a7b05', 'message': 'CoprHD: Handle duplicate display naming error

This fix allows an openstack user to create more than 1 resource with same
display names. As CoprHD currently has no support for this, we append a
unique ID to the display name before sending the request to CoprHD.

Logic has been added to append the Openstack Volume ID with the volume
name, this volume ID will only be appended to the volume name in CoprHD.
In Openstack the display name will be shown as provided by the user.

Change-Id: Ie0df89a84a8135851c35825c26ffce600e855843
Closes-Bug: #1653634
'}]
commit_message:
CoprHD: Handle duplicate display naming error

This fix allows an openstack user to create more than 1 resource with same
display names. As CoprHD currently has no support for this, we append a
unique ID to the display name before sending the request to CoprHD.

Logic has been added to append the Openstack Volume ID with the volume
name, this volume ID will only be appended to the volume name in CoprHD.
In Openstack the display name will be shown as provided by the user.

Change-Id: Ie0df89a84a8135851c35825c26ffce600e855843
Closes-Bug: #1653634

commit_message:
make incremental effective when cinder-backup create

An incremental column is added to backups table and it's
default value is false, then 'incremental' can be used
in backup.drivers.ceph.CephBackupDriver.backup. When
volume is rbd and incremental is true, attempt incremental
backup.

Change-Id: I9fe912a4aeb4d5ff8a648800c91943c423323514
Close-bug: #1578036
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/62/480062/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: incremental = Column(Boolean, nullable=False, default=False)

commit_message:
Nosec verify=False until driver writer review

In an effort to clean up Cinder's Bandit run, issue B501 (Requests call
with verify=False disabling SSL certificate checks) from Bandit
has been nosec'd until the driver implementers are able to implement
this security feature. We decided against blacklisting the Bandit issue
so that future code writers will carefully consider enabling this
security measure.

Change-Id: If88335041807a450849e39e416ec01566c3dde0d

commit_message:
Increase existence check for image when create volumes

Obviously, there have some existence check for volumes and snapshot.
However, there has not a existence check for image if we create a
volume from a image. And there must be have some exceptions if image
has been deleted when we create a volume. So this patch is aim to add
a check for image, and avoid to produce such exceptions.

Change-Id: Iaaf2ba7d2d9e52fd5102c31d38f00f2d1602bf4e
Closed-Bug #1644397

commit_message:
Integrate oslo.config validator

Adds the oslo configuration file validator as a new entry point.

The config validator is a tool intended for use by operators to validate
their modified configuration files before standing up services in production.

Change-Id: Iea7f5408ecaf9750cf13a9a7c20472c01f84d280
Depends-On: I78d3621afda226f5968963ef408507234dfead4c

commit_message:
Update wording in @safe_connect placement warnings

We're well past the point of Placement being required,
so this drops the wording about Newton and Ocata and
just makes the warnings say that Placement is required.

Change-Id: I42730e6ef0ac66efe9122ac3078ca15c1071b080

commit_message:
get error information while choosing next page on dashboard

There have been 5 volumes exsit, and 2 volumes per page.
After deleting the second volume in second page,  I get the error
information "Unable to retrieve list of volumes." on dashboard.
cinder should catch the exception when marker is deleted volume.

Change-Id: I9792c05685b3fc6820c75ceea4117eac6cec60a7
Close-Bug: #1672649

commit_message:
Volume replication support in GPFS driver

GPFS supports data mirroring and replication for high availability
of data. More information can be found at https://ibm.biz/Bdr7kd.
This patch adds the support of replication in GPFS driver by exposing
the underlying capability to the scheduler.

DocImpact
Needs an update in GPFS driver documentation, as this patch introduces
replication support for the GPFS backend.

Change-Id: I776fcb1a29b1b225dd81ead18ab45ab0241c518b

subject: Support FICON-attached ECKD volumes on System z
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-15 15:10:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/71b7ac95ee3d3be6a9267a98ed9405ffd24aa25c', 'message': 'Support FICON-attached ECKD volumes on System z

FICON (Fibre Connection) is a Fibre-Channel FC-4 layer protocol. It is
used on mainframes to attach ECKD volumes via Fibre-Channel. While FICON
shares a common transport protocol with FCP, there are several
differences. ECKD volumes are addressed by a Control Unit and Unit
Address, rather than a LUN. Besides, different commands are required in
order to attach an ECKD volume to a hypervisor.

Implements: blueprint linux-ficon-support

Change-Id: I1ba52d83907fd094be7c8480c5a5bf918876caa5

commit_message:
Support FICON-attached ECKD volumes on System z

FICON (Fibre Connection) is a Fibre-Channel FC-4 layer protocol. It is
used on mainframes to attach ECKD volumes via Fibre-Channel. While FICON
shares a common transport protocol with FCP, there are several
differences. ECKD volumes are addressed by a Control Unit and Unit
Address, rather than a LUN. Besides, different commands are required in
order to attach an ECKD volume to a hypervisor.

Implements: blueprint linux-ficon-support
Change-Id: I1ba52d83907fd094be7c8480c5a5bf918876caa5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/21/342921/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class FibreChannelECKDDriver(VolumeDriver): """Executes commands relating to ECKD volumes.""" def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(FibreChannelDriver, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) def initialize_connection(self, volume, connector): """Initializes the connection and returns connection info. The driver returns a driver_volume_type of 'fibre_channel_eckd'. The cula represents the control unit logical address of the target volume. The unit_address represents the unit address of the target volume. Example return values: .. code-block:: json { 'driver_volume_type': 'fibre_channel_eckd' 'data': { 'target_discovered': True, 'cula': 0xa1, 'unit_address': 0x73, 'discard': False, } } """ msg = _("Driver must implement initialize_connection") raise NotImplementedError(msg) def validate_connector(self, connector): """Fail if connector doesn't contain all the data needed by driver. """ pass

commit_message:
Tegile driver doesn't honor create from snapshot volume size

create_volume_from_snapshot can specify a volume size larger than
the original snapshot. Tegile driver doesn't appear to handle this size
difference. This patch fixes it.

Co-Authored-By: Xinli Guan <xinli@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: Id8cc82ec9d1565f7cbd38684f6d1a712cfba1cd6
Closes-Bug: #1560640

commit_message:
Allow volume migration between different availablity zones

Currently volume migration bewteen different availability zones does not
work. To solve this issue, the following procedue should be done:
1. Add a new configuration item 'enable_across_az_migrate'. If enabled
volume migration between different AZ's will be allowed. Otherwise, not
allowed.
2. Add two volume backend with same 'volume_backend_name'.
3. Allocated different AZ for different backend. After that, restart the
cinder volume service.
4. Migrate volume to the different AZ.

Closes-Bug: #1550353
Change-Id: I444c2b50bcc3842a4f0fe3d74fbfaef89126fc83

commit_message:
Update 'update' queries for transfers table

A new column 'revision_number' is added  to the 'transfers' table
and queries which update this table need to need to be modified to
account for this change.

Implements: blueprint ha-db-object-version-counter
Co-Authored-By: Szymon Wroblewski <szymon.wroblewski@intel.com>

Change-Id: Ide12db59f368a29606a18fa22f84cb88f2965f77

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests

Instead of assertEqual(False, A) and assertEqual(True, A)
use assertFalse(A) and assertTrue(A).
They are compatible with Python 3.5[1]

[1]: https://docs.python.org/3.5/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: I0a7b11044b9968de9d9402c1a35b28374487b16c

commit_message:
FalconStor: Support generic group

Add CG capability to Groups.

Change-Id: Ifb298ba827cc575695eec1f629108f53c08b66d0
Closes-Bug: #1682248
Implements: blueprint falconstor-generic-group

commit_message:
HPE3PAR: Retype replication volume with provisioning

3PAR cannot change provisioning of replicated
volume, which has remote copy. so the workaround
is to stop the remote copy, change the
provisioning and then start remote copy.

Change-Id: I279f460a55b6bdf7c8f0689307291657e0504ca3
Closes-bug: 1714473
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/48/500348/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

The match for dependency names is case sensitive, so change
"pastedeploy" to "PasteDeploy".

The match for dependencies takes the environment markers into account,
so add a marker for dnspython to restrict its use to python 2.7. There
is a dnspython3 package for use with version 3, and that can be added

Change-Id: Ia2bb2e1846d734609ea9ff37d2ad1ffd37ced950

commit_message:
update requirements to support matching global exclusions

The match for dependency names is case sensitive, so change
"pastedeploy" to "PasteDeploy".

The match for dependencies takes the environment markers into account,
so add a marker for dnspython to restrict its use to python 2.7. There
is a dnspython3 package for use with version 3, and that can be added
separately as part of the python 3 porting work.

Change-Id: Ia2bb2e1846d734609ea9ff37d2ad1ffd37ced950
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/560109
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/11/560111/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: dnspython>=1.14.0;python_version=='2.7' # http://www.dnspython.org/LICENSEPasteDeploy>=1.3.3

subject: Remove the need for OpenStackConfig in CloudRegion
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-23 15:55:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/a334c2155bc8f38233538c9a61597e67f98886ac', 'message': "Remove the need for OpenStackConfig in CloudRegion

There are a few things in CloudRegion that require calling back out to
the creating OpenStackConfig object. However, now that creating a
CloudRegion directly is a thing, those calls have become more awkward.

Shift the cache settings and methods to CloudRegion along with the
extra_config logic. Move two of the utility methods in loader into a
_util file so that both loader and cloud_region can import it. This
renames get_cache_expiration to get_cache_expirations, but I'm fairly
confident that the only consumer of get_cache_expirations here is
openstack.cloud.

Change-Id: Ia6ed0f00bfc2483bd09169811198cdf1a0ab2f15
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-29 16:06:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/5e2ed5872eb4fda8ffb5b07796d329426d0a4c5f', 'message': "Remove the need for OpenStackConfig in CloudRegion

There are a few things in CloudRegion that require calling back out to
the creating OpenStackConfig object. However, now that creating a
CloudRegion directly is a thing, those calls have become more awkward.

Shift the cache settings and methods to CloudRegion along with the
extra_config logic. Move two of the utility methods in loader into a
_util file so that both loader and cloud_region can import it. This
renames get_cache_expiration to get_cache_expirations, but I'm fairly
confident that the only consumer of get_cache_expirations here is
openstack.cloud.

Leave passing in the OpenStackConfig for now, because osc uses it.
However, if we can get osc shifted to using get_password_callback, we
can get rid of it.

Change-Id: Ia6ed0f00bfc2483bd09169811198cdf1a0ab2f15
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2018-03-29 17:16:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/ad88c454b40e80c1e846cda0b13f15d6738a8586', 'message': "Remove the need for OpenStackConfig in CloudRegion

There are a few things in CloudRegion that require calling back out to
the creating OpenStackConfig object. However, now that creating a
CloudRegion directly is a thing, those calls have become more awkward.

Shift the cache settings and methods to CloudRegion along with the
extra_config logic. Move two of the utility methods in loader into a
_util file so that both loader and cloud_region can import it. This
renames get_cache_expiration to get_cache_expirations, but I'm fairly
confident that the only consumer of get_cache_expirations here is
openstack.cloud.

Leave passing in the OpenStackConfig for now, because osc uses it.
However, if we can get osc shifted to using get_password_callback, we
can get rid of it.

Change-Id: Ia6ed0f00bfc2483bd09169811198cdf1a0ab2f15
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2018-03-30 13:23:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/27a4f58d64f1061e1aff94051850a1c760092c51', 'message': "Remove the need for OpenStackConfig in CloudRegion

There are a few things in CloudRegion that require calling back out to
the creating OpenStackConfig object. However, now that creating a

commit_message:
Remove the need for OpenStackConfig in CloudRegion

There are a few things in CloudRegion that require calling back out to
the creating OpenStackConfig object. However, now that creating a
CloudRegion directly is a thing, those calls have become more awkward.

Shift the cache settings and methods to CloudRegion along with the
extra_config logic. Move two of the utility methods in loader into a
_util file so that both loader and cloud_region can import it. This
renames get_cache_expiration to get_cache_expirations, but I'm fairly
confident that the only consumer of get_cache_expirations here is
openstack.cloud.

Leave passing in the OpenStackConfig for now, because osc uses it.
However, if we can get osc shifted to using get_password_callback, we
can get rid of it.

Change-Id: Ia6ed0f00bfc2483bd09169811198cdf1a0ab2f15
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/88/547488/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def merge_clouds(old_dict, new_dict): """Like dict.update, except handling nested dicts.""" ret = old_dict.copy() for (k, v) in new_dict.items(): if isinstance(v, dict): if k in ret: ret[k] = merge_clouds(ret[k], v) else: ret[k] = v.copy() else: ret[k] = v return ret

commit_message:
Move xenapi partition copies to privsep.

I am unsure if I should be concerned about the lack of error
checking here, but this is how it was originally.

Change-Id: I9c1dfd5a90a53d90a44baae4874965bf8f48cea1
blueprint: hurrah-for-privsep
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/05/553605/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @nova.privsep.sys_admin_pctxt.entrypoint def block_copy(src_path, dst_path, block_size, num_blocks): processutils.execute('dd', 'if=%s' % src_path, 'of=%s' % dst_path, 'bs=%d' % block_size, 'count=%d' % num_blocks, 'iflag=direct,sync', 'oflag=direct,sync')

commit_message:
Add variables to connect ELK and Grafana

With the option to deploy grafana the following changes allow a user to
automatically connect ELK and Grafana.

Change-Id: Ic8e64a31d860940c6863f46ce558908d5ef8f8e7
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add tags fields for server list detail/show api-ref

As of the 2.26 microversion, the 'tags' field is in the response for
showing details about a given server, but the tags field is not in
the response table description for that API.

This patch added tags field for server list detail and show API.

Co-Authored-By: Artom Lifshitz <alifshit@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Idef667d7c8b1cd4781ccd391a481af3d46113f4e
Closes-Bug: #1673628

commit_message:
use sub-resource API extension support

Now that neutron-lib supports sub-resources [1], there's no need for
extension classes to override update_attributes_map and
get_extended_resources to add their own sub-resources. This patch
removes those methods from the qos extensions class.

NeutronLibImpact

[1] I8ae11633962a48de6e8559b85447b8c8c753d705

Change-Id: Ibb66246091fd84e18c56009f5fcb8fdea3aff6b7

commit_message:
Add autoescape parameter to jinja env

We create enviroment object and use that to load templates, but this
templates can be changed by user. This can lead to security problems.

Change-Id: I294f49c15d0d7987870c077438af291a6ac6816f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/84/561184/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: loader=template_loader, trim_blocks=True, lstrip_blocks=True, autoescape=jinja2.select_autoescape(['html', 'xml']))

commit_message:
Dell EMC SC: volume model update return missing vol id

Create_group_from_src is not returning the volume id along with
the other volume updates. Manager.py uses this to update the db.

Added this id to create_group_from_src return.

Closes-Bug: #1759897
Change-Id: I240df78363182e4e8017f89b67c0f7d7bf6819c8
(cherry picked from commit 430a292b836cde4386c88f467a016ee17fef40eb)

commit_message:
V3 jsonschema validation: volume actions

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below volume actions API's
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (attach)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (detach)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (volume_upload_image)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (extend)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (retype)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (initialize_connection)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (terminate_connection)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (set_bootable_status)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (update_readonly_flag)

Change-Id: I39ede009d5e909a076860df7305865286caa5352
Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Additionally:
* add funcsigs to lower-constraints.txt
* set lower-constraint for sphinx=1.6.2

Change-Id: Ia9d795125a00d4bbe6d52738f0d8dc286ed4c676
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Expose shutdown retry interval as config setting

This option is in the driver interface but was hard coded in the manager
class.

Defaults to old value (10 seconds) if not set in configuration file.

Change-Id: I0c8db2efec6098c017aad2f6588938bc548db139

commit_message:
Catch exceptions when updating service

service_manage_report is periodically called by the engine service
timer.  If an exception occurs during the execution of
service_manage_report, the timer is killed.  This leaves the engine
service to believe it is dead.

With this change any exceptions encountered during service update will
be caught and logged without killing the timer.

The same exception handling is added to service_manage_cleanup.

Closes-Bug: #1763490

Change-Id: Id1ba7f9c815cfebe2b2d269640a6544ababd7ae8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/74/561074/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import eventlet @mock.patch('senlin.engine.dispatcher.Dispatcher') @mock.patch('senlin.engine.health_manager.HealthManager') @mock.patch('oslo_messaging.Target') @mock.patch.object(service_obj.Service, 'update') def test_engine_manage_report(self, mock_update, mock_msg_cls, mock_hm_cls, mock_disp_cls): cfg.CONF.set_override('periodic_interval', 1) # start engine and verify that update is being called more than once self.eng.start() eventlet.sleep(6) self.assertGreater(mock_update.call_count, 1) self.eng.stop() @mock.patch('senlin.engine.dispatcher.Dispatcher') @mock.patch('senlin.engine.health_manager.HealthManager') @mock.patch('oslo_messaging.Target') @mock.patch.object(service_obj.Service, 'update') def test_engine_manage_report_with_exception(self, mock_update, mock_msg_cls, mock_hm_cls, mock_disp_cls): cfg.CONF.set_override('periodic_interval', 1) # start engine and verify that update is being called more than once # even with the exception being thrown mock_update.side_effect = Exception('blah') self.eng.start() eventlet.sleep(6) self.assertGreater(mock_update.call_count, 1) self.eng.stop()

commit_message:
Add host to API and Conductor

The instance action event is recorded in API/Conductor/Compute using
EventReporter, in order to help admins to find the host of events
occurring we also need pass the host info to EventReporter.

In compute, we already have a self.host on the
nova.compute.manager.ComputeManager, but API/Conductor doesn't contain
this.

In order to get host conveniently, this patch add host to API and
Conductor, and set it to CONF.host when api and conductor initialize.

Part of blueprint: add-host-to-instance-action-events

Change-Id: Idf57fb5fbc611abb83943bd7e36d3cebf03b3977
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/13/556513/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Removes odl-dlux-gui feature for ODL

The GUI feature is no longer supported with ODL and needs to be removed.
We relied on the URL provided by this feature in order to run our docker
healtcheck, which is modified in the depends-on patch to a new URI.

Depends-On: I2f33d2cf6a96005ef1d18468a8d2fcc71b17b6f8

Related-Bug: 1751857

Change-Id: I762789e65913b4f653bbf9019b5d3d05903912f1
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit f51f5336798751d9a23b69c4c301f748251a6064)

commit_message:
Fixes ODL healthcheck URI

In the past we used index.html to ensure ODL container was healthy.
This page was provided by the GUI plugins into ODL.  Now that those
plugins are no longer supported, we need to move to a more reliable URI
path.

Related-Bug: 1751857

Change-Id: I2f33d2cf6a96005ef1d18468a8d2fcc71b17b6f8
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9e72a429d1ae1d6be2e747a973be6b6c072cd630)

commit_message:
Change permissions on SSL keys to 640

This tightens up the security on the SSL keys stored in
/etc/apache2/ssl/<service> to be no longer world readable.

This is a backport from master:
cherry-pick: 6470d6dd2c261a74c128004ad1a75e6f134b6691

Change-Id: I5c6349d421f9ee0627dc95797291a466dee7fe37
Related-Bug: #1761305

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-26 21:52:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a5c1caccab1e138f6f9313bb4a30aebf3293db87', 'message': 'Support forbidden traits in allocation_candidates in db

Adjust the generated SQL and surrounding python code to support

commit_message:
[placement] Filter allocation candidates by forbidden traits in db

Adjust the generated SQL and surrounding python code to support
expressing forbidden traits when requesting allocation candidates.
Any resource provider which has a forbidden trait will not be
included.

The RequestGroup object now supports a forbidden_traits attribute.
Code in forthcoming patches will adjust the query string processing
that creates a RequestGroup to set that attribute if the calling code
is using the right microversion.

Partially implements blueprint placement-forbidden-traits
Change-Id: I53f6fce0810c53551710407df7ab1689282e73f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/60/556660/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_forbidden_one_group(self): qs = ('resources=VCPU:2,MEMORY_MB:2048' '&required=CUSTOM_PHYSNET1,!CUSTOM_SWITCH_BIG') expected = [ pl.RequestGroup( use_same_provider=False, resources={ 'VCPU': 2, 'MEMORY_MB': 2048, }, required_traits={ 'CUSTOM_PHYSNET1', }, forbidden_traits={ 'CUSTOM_SWITCH_BIG', } ), ] self.assertRequestGroupsEqual(expected, self.do_parse(qs)) def test_forbidden_conflict(self): qs = ('resources=VCPU:2,MEMORY_MB:2048' '&required=CUSTOM_PHYSNET1,!CUSTOM_PHYSNET1') expected_message = ('Conflicting required and forbidden traits found ' 'in the following traits keys: required') exc = self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest, self.do_parse, qs) self.assertEqual(expected_message, str(exc)) def test_forbidden_two_groups(self): qs = ('resources=VCPU:2,MEMORY_MB:2048&resources1=CUSTOM_MAGIC:1' '&required1=CUSTOM_PHYSNET1,!CUSTOM_PHYSNET2') expected = [ pl.RequestGroup( use_same_provider=False, resources={ 'VCPU': 2, 'MEMORY_MB': 2048, }, ), pl.RequestGroup( resources={ 'CUSTOM_MAGIC': 1, }, required_traits={ 'CUSTOM_PHYSNET1', }, forbidden_traits={ 'CUSTOM_PHYSNET2', } ), ] self.assertRequestGroupsEqual(expected, self.do_parse(qs)) def test_forbidden_separate_groups_no_conflict(self): qs = ('resources1=CUSTOM_MAGIC:1&required1=CUSTOM_PHYSNET1' '&resources2=CUSTOM_MAGIC:1&required2=!CUSTOM_PHYSNET1') expected = [ pl.RequestGroup( use_same_provider=True, resources={ 'CUSTOM_MAGIC': 1, }, required_traits={ 'CUSTOM_PHYSNET1', } ), pl.RequestGroup( use_same_provider=True, resources={ 'CUSTOM_MAGIC': 1, }, forbidden_traits={ 'CUSTOM_PHYSNET1', } ), ] self.assertRequestGroupsEqual(expected, self.do_parse(qs))

commit_message:
Fix ports_per_network bug in create port

ports_per_network means the number of ports for one network.
However, in some test cases, the number of ports for one network
is more than ports_per_network.
This patch fix this.

Change-Id: If03b345e5643081da3d546e42eade5cae474b1ea
Close-bug: #1664153
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/00/561100/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: network = self._create_network(network_create_args) network = self._create_network(network_create_args)

commit_message:
Debian is using python3-vitrageclient

Change-Id: If75b85bd2daa17abcf7036b50e5a8008c4195d93
Depends-On: I1bb3489acf1f591eefbad91bdbb666b21a53238a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-vitrage refs/changes/38/560738/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :name => platform_params[:client_package_name], let(:platform_params) do case facts[:osfamily] when 'Debian' if facts[:os_package_type] == 'debian' { :client_package_name => 'python3-vitrageclient' } else { :client_package_name => 'python-vitrageclient' } end when 'RedHat' { :client_package_name => 'python-vitrageclient' } end end

commit_message:
[placement] Filter resource providers by forbidden traits in db

This is the db-side work for filtering resource providers by
forbidden traits. Since we control whether forbidden is allowed
or not at the API layer, we can add support here in the DB layer
such that it works all the time.

Subsequent patches will turn on the the functionality in a microversion.

Partially implements blueprint placement-forbidden-traits
Change-Id: I46796d49931df20b002d1a7e6bb3a6be34dabefa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/72/556472/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_all_by_filters_from_db(context, filters, allow_forbidden): required = set(filters.pop('required', [])) forbidden = set() if allow_forbidden: forbidden = set([trait for trait in required if trait.startswith('!')]) required = required - forbidden forbidden = set([trait.lstrip('!') for trait in forbidden]) # If 'forbidden' has values, filter out those providers that have # that trait as one their traits. if forbidden: trait_map = _trait_ids_from_names(context, forbidden) if len(trait_map) != len(forbidden): missing = forbidden - set(trait_map) raise exception.TraitNotFound(names=', '.join(missing)) rp_ids = _get_provider_ids_having_any_trait(context, trait_map) if rp_ids: query = query.where(~rp.c.id.in_(rp_ids)) def get_all_by_filters(cls, context, filters=None, allow_forbidden=False): :param allow_forbidden: If True, allow processing of forbidden traits. resource_providers = cls._get_all_by_filters_from_db( context, filters, allow_forbidden)
deleted_lines: def _get_all_by_filters_from_db(context, filters): required = filters.pop('required', []) def get_all_by_filters(cls, context, filters=None): resource_providers = cls._get_all_by_filters_from_db(context, filters)

commit_message:
[placement] Parse forbidden traits in query strings

Add support to parse_qs_request_groups to optionally process the
"required" parameter for forbidden traits, expressed as the
normal trait form prefixed with "!". The parsing removes "!"
prefixed traits from the required_traits attribute on a
RequestGroup and puts them (without the "!") in a new
forbidden_traits attribute.

The optionality allows the caller to control the processing
based on the microversion. Later code will add that to
the list resource providers and list allocation canidates
handler code, in the same microversion.

This allows declaring forbidden handling only at the API layer.
Subsequent patches will turn on forbidden handling in the object/
data layer but no forbidden traits will reach that layer until
the microversion turns on allow_forbidden in the API.

Partially implements blueprint placement-forbidden-traits
Change-Id: Icc9dc2631a0eca9e998b9ce8706c7b6920e0cb69
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/19/556819/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def do_parse(qstring, allow_forbidden=False): urlparse.parse_qsl(qstring)), allow_forbidden) def test_forbidden_one_group(self): qs = ('resources=VCPU:2,MEMORY_MB:2048' '&required=CUSTOM_PHYSNET1,!CUSTOM_SWITCH_BIG') expected_no_forbidden = [ pl.RequestGroup( use_same_provider=False, resources={ 'VCPU': 2, 'MEMORY_MB': 2048, }, required_traits={ 'CUSTOM_PHYSNET1', '!CUSTOM_SWITCH_BIG', }, ), ] expected_forbidden = [ pl.RequestGroup( use_same_provider=False, resources={ 'VCPU': 2, 'MEMORY_MB': 2048, }, required_traits={ 'CUSTOM_PHYSNET1', }, forbidden_traits={ 'CUSTOM_SWITCH_BIG', } ), ] self.assertRequestGroupsEqual(expected_no_forbidden, self.do_parse(qs)) self.assertRequestGroupsEqual( expected_forbidden, self.do_parse(qs, allow_forbidden=True)) def test_forbidden_conflict(self): qs = ('resources=VCPU:2,MEMORY_MB:2048' '&required=CUSTOM_PHYSNET1,!CUSTOM_PHYSNET1') expected_message = ('Conflicting required and forbidden traits found ' 'in the following traits keys: required') exc = self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest, self.do_parse, qs, allow_forbidden=True) self.assertEqual(expected_message, str(exc)) def test_forbidden_two_groups(self): qs = ('resources=VCPU:2,MEMORY_MB:2048&resources1=CUSTOM_MAGIC:1' '&required1=CUSTOM_PHYSNET1,!CUSTOM_PHYSNET2') expected = [ pl.RequestGroup( use_same_provider=False, resources={ 'VCPU': 2, 'MEMORY_MB': 2048, }, ), pl.RequestGroup( resources={ 'CUSTOM_MAGIC': 1, }, required_traits={ 'CUSTOM_PHYSNET1', }, forbidden_traits={ 'CUSTOM_PHYSNET2', } ), ] self.assertRequestGroupsEqual( expected, self.do_parse(qs, allow_forbidden=True)) def test_forbidden_separate_groups_no_conflict(self): qs = ('resources1=CUSTOM_MAGIC:1&required1=CUSTOM_PHYSNET1' '&resources2=CUSTOM_MAGIC:1&required2=!CUSTOM_PHYSNET1') expected = [ pl.RequestGroup( use_same_provider=True, resources={ 'CUSTOM_MAGIC': 1, }, required_traits={ 'CUSTOM_PHYSNET1', } ), pl.RequestGroup( use_same_provider=True, resources={ 'CUSTOM_MAGIC': 1, }, forbidden_traits={ 'CUSTOM_PHYSNET1', } ), ] self.assertRequestGroupsEqual( expected, self.do_parse(qs, allow_forbidden=True))

commit_message:
Allow cascade deletion of load balancer

According to the v2 api reference:
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/load-balancer/v2/#remove-a-load-balancer
The optional parameter cascade when defined as true will delete all
child objects of the load balancer.

Change-Id: I3290eeae6c11fc9c42bffc19ccac9c8375932f1e

commit_message:
use rpc Connection rather than create_connection

The create_connection function in neutron.common.rpc is just an alias to
Connection. This patch switches to the later so we can remove the former
in: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560130

Change-Id: I623691146fb1ee85a00a1d507ea5ffef84ae52d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-sfc refs/changes/23/561023/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Doc: Add driver security notes to contributor doc

Document some requirements that driver authors should
consider when creating drivers.

Change-Id: Ieae8863d5e4c140545d89c4cfa4e019dbb301a36
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/34/560034/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Security Requirements --------------------- * Drivers must delete volumes in a way where volumes deleted from the backend will not leak data into new volumes when they are created. Cinder operates in multi-tenant environments and this is critical to ensure data safety. * Drivers should support secure TLS/SSL communication between the cinder volume service and the backend as configured by the "driver_ssl_cert_verify" and "driver_ssl_cert_path" options in cinder.conf. * Drivers should use standard Python libraries to handle encryption-related functionality, and not contain custom implementations of encryption code.

But the test_non_ami method of the StreamDiskTestCase class
intermittently failed in the gate jobs.
See https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1763535 for more details.

So the modification in the StreamDiskTestCase class
is reverted temporarily.

Change-Id: I77909d7d2a0f601d4a6f0b899259dd6816c74f35
Related-Bug: #1763535
Implements: blueprint mox-removal

commit_message:
Partially revert "Remove mox in unit/virt/xenapi/test_vm_utils.py (3)"

Mox stubs in test_vm_utils.py was replaced with mock in
I138657464aecf6712804a87f102a430c242d85a4.
But the test_non_ami method of the StreamDiskTestCase class
intermittently failed in the gate jobs.
See https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1763535 for more details.

So the modification in the StreamDiskTestCase class
is reverted temporarily.

Change-Id: I77909d7d2a0f601d4a6f0b899259dd6816c74f35
Related-Bug: #1763535
Implements: blueprint mox-removal
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/21/561121/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(takashin): Needs replacing mox stubs with mock. # But There was an issue when replacing mox stubs with mock # in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559258/. # See https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1763535 class StreamDiskTestCase(VMUtilsTestBase): self.mox.StubOutWithMock(vm_utils.utils, 'make_dev_path') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(vm_utils.utils, 'temporary_chown') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(vm_utils, '_write_partition') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(six.moves.builtins, 'open') self.image_service_func = self.mox.CreateMockAnything() def test_non_ami(self): vm_utils.utils.make_dev_path('dev').AndReturn('some_path') vm_utils.utils.temporary_chown( 'some_path').AndReturn(contextified(None)) open('some_path', 'wb').AndReturn(contextified(fake_file)) self.image_service_func(fake_file) self.mox.ReplayAll() def test_ami_disk(self): vm_utils._write_partition("session", 100, 'dev') vm_utils.utils.make_dev_path('dev').AndReturn('some_path') vm_utils.utils.temporary_chown( 'some_path').AndReturn(contextified(None)) open('some_path', 'wb').AndReturn(contextified(fake_file)) self.image_service_func(fake_file) self.mox.ReplayAll()
deleted_lines: @mock.patch.object(six.moves.builtins, 'open') @mock.patch.object(vm_utils, '_write_partition') @mock.patch.object(vm_utils.utils, 'temporary_chown', return_value=contextified(None)) @mock.patch.object(vm_utils.utils, 'make_dev_path', return_value='some_path') class StreamDiskTestCase(VMUtilsTestBase): self.image_service_func = mock.Mock() def test_non_ami(self, mock_make_dev_path, mock_temporary_chown, mock_write_partition, mock_open): mock_open.return_value = contextified(fake_file) mock_make_dev_path.assert_called_once_with('dev') mock_temporary_chown.assert_called_once_with('some_path') mock_write_partition.assert_not_called() mock_open.assert_called_once_with('some_path', 'wb') self.image_service_func.assert_called_once_with(fake_file) def test_ami_disk(self, mock_make_dev_path, mock_temporary_chown, mock_write_partition, mock_open): mock_open.return_value = contextified(fake_file) mock_write_partition.assert_called_once_with("session", 100, 'dev') mock_make_dev_path.assert_called_once_with('dev') mock_temporary_chown.assert_called_once_with('some_path') mock_open.assert_called_once_with('some_path', 'wb') self.image_service_func.assert_called_once_with(fake_file)

commit_message:
Fix for proper PATH when calling keystone-manage command

Without these changes, calls to keystone-manage will lead to
[Errno 2] No such file or directory

Change-Id: Ib11f8a075a485cd3a76b8cb0ce1712d06f78d036

commit_message:
Sync xenapi and libvirt on what flags to pass e2fsck.

I can't see a good reason for the two drivers to use different
flags, and this simplifies the code a little.

Change-Id: I55cdc22ce8f95dff0cfd1a31b58582fc4b3ea48f
blueprint: hurrah-for-privsep-again

commit_message:
Remove nat/masquerading config workarounds.

1) This reverts commit e47d68eb11d3c2a1360c9018b6a47f05e874ecbc.
   That was technical debt, and with the new service in THT we don't need
   it anymore in Rocky.

2) This removes undercloud_external_network_cidr rule that shouldn't be
   useful since we control in THT for Rocky.

Closes-Bug: #1756183
Change-Id: I39b04f81803d76e419d1f3960edc4c927b2dbd4e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/51/557851/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo sh -c 'iptables-save > /etc/sysconfig/iptables'
deleted_lines: ## * Enable Masquerading for undercloud network. ## This is technical debt, please look for full context: ## https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1756183 ## :: sudo iptables -w -t nat -D POSTROUTING -j BOOTSTACK_MASQ_OVB || true sudo iptables -w -t nat -X BOOTSTACK_MASQ_OVB || true sudo iptables -w -t nat -N BOOTSTACK_MASQ_OVB sudo iptables -w -t nat -A BOOTSTACK_MASQ_OVB -s {{ undercloud_network_cidr }} -d {{ undercloud_network_cidr }} -j RETURN sudo iptables -w -t nat -A BOOTSTACK_MASQ_OVB -s {{ undercloud_network_cidr }} -j MASQUERADE sudo iptables -w -t nat -I POSTROUTING -j BOOTSTACK_MASQ_OVB sudo iptables -w -t nat -F BOOTSTACK_MASQ || true sudo iptables -w -t nat -D POSTROUTING -j BOOTSTACK_MASQ || true sudo iptables -w -t nat -X BOOTSTACK_MASQ || true sudo iptables -w -t nat -E BOOTSTACK_MASQ_OVB BOOTSTACK_MASQ sudo sh -c 'iptables-save > /etc/sysconfig/iptables'

subject: Allow port security to be disabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-29 20:50:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/f47711355650724e6645a38dcad0f671cb9a0dd7', 'message': "Allow port security to be disabled

Allow Murano application packages to specify whether port security
should be disabled for a network.  By default, the Heat service
will enable port security for all ports in a network.  With this
change, Murano will now propagate to Heat the application's
desire to disable port security if the application sets a new
flag, port_security_enabled, to false in the Neutron network object.

Change-Id: Iab25b4901010c24aef42213a7a9082b7594a5a16
Closes-Bug: 1759914

Allow Murano application packages to specify whether port security
should be disabled for a network.  With this change, Murano will now
propagate to Heat the application's desire to disable port security
if the application sets a new flag, port_security_disable, to true
in the Neutron network object.

Change-Id: Iab25b4901010c24aef42213a7a9082b7594a5a16
Closes-Bug: 1759914
"}]
commit_message:
Allow port security to be disabled

Allow Murano application packages to specify whether port security
should be disabled for a network.  With this change, Murano will now
propagate to Heat the application's desire to disable port security
if the application sets a new flag, port_security_disable, to true
in the Neutron network object.

Change-Id: Iab25b4901010c24aef42213a7a9082b7594a5a16
Closes-Bug: 1759914

commit_message:
Simplify init-runonce boot command

openstack cli now supports --network foo rather than having to find the
network uuid. Thanks to mgoddard for the tip.

Change-Id: I9ce94a86c6950b81ef3ec70fe10ee565cc1f1171

commit_message:
set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

Change-Id: I2ac4c36cf0d3786da9bb35abf28c039da7b8aa1e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: NetApp E-Series: Fix broken generic volume groups
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-11 14:41:59.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/eseries/fc_driver.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/eseries/iscsi_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/664974c0218519d2740ae4284a4b977269d76df9', 'message': 'NetApp E-Series: Fix broken generic volume groups

The Generic Volume Groups functionality is currently broken in the
E-Series driver because it is not defining/removing a back-end
consistency group when creating/deleting a generic group.

This patch adds an implementation method in the respective E-Series
drivers to utilize the underlying CG functionality.

Closes-Bug: #1706777
Change-Id: I55dc417060d9226c2f120a16b031a79839d483d3
(cherry picked from commit 443dfd9d8c464ba18d2fcd5c3b3fc10602923fde)

commit_message:
NetApp E-Series: Fix broken generic volume groups

The Generic Volume Groups functionality is currently broken in the
E-Series driver because it is not defining/removing a back-end
consistency group when creating/deleting a generic group.

This patch adds an implementation method in the respective E-Series
drivers to utilize the underlying CG functionality.

Closes-Bug: #1706777
Change-Id: I55dc417060d9226c2f120a16b031a79839d483d3
(cherry picked from commit 443dfd9d8c464ba18d2fcd5c3b3fc10602923fde)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/51/560451/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def create_group(self, context, group): return self.create_consistencygroup(context, group) def delete_group(self, context, group, volumes): return self.library.delete_consistencygroup(group, volumes)

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Remove the '[build_sphinx]' and [pbr] sections as described in:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128594.html

Adds the use of sphinxcontrib.apidoc to get (mostly) the same output as what
was provided by the removed [pbr] section.

Change-Id: Ie7e3acef7161cb8f218c2333167490c8116a2122
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560270/

commit_message:
Fix live migration failed because the host_uuid missing

because the libvirt host_uuid missing, when run live migration,
nova will get the host uuid, if all host uuid is the same value,
the action will failed because nova think it attempt to migrate
guest to the same host.

Change-Id: Ib8c8e9243bb01117e8863801f834cfd4c78089ab
Closes-Bug: #1745557
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/01/538201/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: host_uuid = "{{ HOST_UUID }}"

commit_message:
Updates jobs running on the election repo

Currently we run the requirements-check job on the election repo which
isn't really helpful as these tools don't really need to be
co-installable with OpenStack services.

We're also *not* running any kind of linter so we have a few code
style issues creeping in.

This removes requirements-check and adds a non-voting linter to the
check pipeline.  We can upgrade the latter to voting once all issues
are fixed, which wont be during the current TC election.

Change-Id: Id2ad76b587ef50104d6410c8d6c497bf291ed662

added_lines: - openstack-zuul-jobs-linters: voting: false

commit_message:
Modify the lock password test

This change converts a previously change:

  Icf1776c5fe625c2e9292bfcf40a8a9f17a002656

It mainly gets a validation case passing and reworks the
logic of a newly added test to do everything through the API,
instead of calling into the backends directly.

Change-Id: I22b959a9b81a23e35e95a80d8951b61166a718ea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/66/561366/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: password = uuid.uuid4().hex ref = unit.new_user_ref(domain_id=self.domain_id, password=password) response = self.post('/users', body={'user': ref}) user_id = response.json_body['user']['id'] # Lock the user's password user_patch = {'user': {'options': {lock_pw_opt: True}}} self.patch('/users/%s' % user_id, body=user_patch) new_password = uuid.uuid4().hex body = { 'user': { 'original_password': password, 'password': new_password } } path = '/users/%s/password' % user_id self.post(path, body=body, expected_status=http_client.BAD_REQUEST) user_patch['user']['options'][lock_pw_opt] = False self.patch('/users/%s' % user_id, body=user_patch) path = '/users/%s/password' % user_id self.post(path, body=body, expected_status=http_client.NO_CONTENT) auth_data = self.build_authentication_request( user_id=user_id, password=new_password self.v3_create_token( auth_data, expected_status=http_client.CREATED ) path = '/users/%s' % user_id user = self.get(path).json_body['user'] self.assertIn(lock_pw_opt, user['options']) self.assertFalse(user['options'][lock_pw_opt]) # Completely unset the option from the user's reference user_patch['user']['options'][lock_pw_opt] = None self.patch('/users/%s' % user_id, body=user_patch) path = '/users/%s' % user_id user = self.get(path).json_body['user'] self.assertNotIn(lock_pw_opt, user['options'])
deleted_lines: # enable minimum_password_age via override, this should have no effect # on admin password reset self.config_fixture.config(group='security_compliance', minimum_password_age=0) # enable minimum_password_age override to "forever" and attempt to # change password new_password = uuid.uuid4().hex self.user_ref['options'][lock_pw_opt] = True PROVIDERS.identity_api.update_user(self.user_ref['id'], self.user_ref) self.change_password(password=new_password, original_password=self.user_ref['password'], expected_status=http_client.BAD_REQUEST) self.user_ref['options'][lock_pw_opt] = False PROVIDERS.identity_api.update_user(self.user_ref['id'], self.user_ref) self.change_password(password=new_password, original_password=self.user_ref['password'], expected_status=http_client.NO_CONTENT) self.token = self.get_request_token( new_password, http_client.CREATED

commit_message:
OSH-infra: move charts to use ingress manifest in htk

This moves all relevant charts in osh-infra to use the htk manifest
template for ingresses, bringing them in line with the charts in
openstack-helm

Change-Id: Ic9c3cc6f0051fa66b6f88ec2b2725698b36ce824

commit_message:
add exclusion specifiers used by swift

These exclusions are needed to allow swift's requirements to be
compatible with the global list.

Change-Id: I6321484760c8a61c379ddf37b7b797ac092a28c2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove the branch specifier from the nova-multiattach job

For in-tree job definitions, the job is branch-specific
by design, so we don't need the stable branch exclusion
specifier as it won't run on those branches anyway since
it's not defined for those branches.

Related to https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2001839
Related-Bug: #1763382

Change-Id: I78dead482e2ed8262745cb08c9f4ab71035adb33
(cherry picked from commit 406c9d13db80d05f6668c2eee3eae867fd91ceb9)

commit_message:
Add grafana

This change introduces grafana into the stack which gives us a great
way to visualize the data. The grafana role from cloudalchemy is being
used for the bulk of the deployment.

Because the grafana deployment playbook is now standalone the mentions
of grafana in the other ops directories have been removed.

Change-Id: I23e1c96cd1fda7ece9b86a69f9f0326913de714d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
featureset20 requires larger instances

In order to execute a full run of tempest
in the time alloted to tripleo-ci jobs in
rdo software factory more cpu and memory
is required.
If featureset020, then use m1.ci.xlarge
vs m1.ci.large

Related-Bug: #1758932
Change-Id: I7a38a70f9a5c3199be095c94bb1753f6d026c5a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/15/557015/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ $FEATURESET_FILE == featureset020 ]]; then sed -i -e "s/baremetal_flavor:.*/baremetal_flavor: ci.m1.large/" $ENVFILE else sed -i -e "s/baremetal_flavor:.*/baremetal_flavor: ci.m1.xlarge/" $ENVFILE fi

commit_message:
Ensure we do not pass invalid data for A records

DNSPython does not allow IPs to have leading zeros
for A records [1] and eventlet agrees [2], so we should
ensure we do not create a situation where a project can
DOS itself.

This patch uses the DNSPython method to ensure it is kept in sync

1 - https://github.com/rthalley/dnspython/blob/v1.15.0/dns/ipv4.py#L52-L54
2 - https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/blob/v0.20.0/eventlet/support/dns/ipv4.py#L52-L54

Partial-Bug: 1760833
Change-Id: I975b18d390647de9fe11c105cd421b761f88be6c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/69/558869/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from dns import ipv4 import dns.exception try: # make sure that DNS Python agrees that it is a valid IP address ipv4.inet_aton(value) except dns.exception.SyntaxError: raise ValueError()

commit_message:
set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

Change-Id: I64799bb18c6c5848d23378e163481ad0fe1eea2b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/castellan refs/changes/08/561308/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Documenting l3_flavors extn in api-ref

Adding description and flavor_id as optional to each command

Closes-Bug: #1733378

Change-Id: Ia942df1a3749242762d6a7a920636e6c145f74e3
Signed-off-by: Michal Kelner Mishali <mkelnermishal@vmware.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/84/536084/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: L3 flavors extension (``l3-flavors``) ===================================== The router flavor extension (``l3-flavors``) adds support to the in-tree L3 service plugin so requests can be dispatched to different drivers depending on the flavor associated with a given router. - flavor_id: router-flavor_id - flavor_id: router-flavor_id-optional - flavor_id: router-flavor_id - flavor_id: router-flavor_id - flavor_id: router-flavor_id

commit_message:
remove debtcollector from requirements

Once we clean-up our debt with the patches under this one, there's no
need for the debtcollector in neutron-lib.

This patch removes debtcollector from our requirements and lower
constraints.

Change-Id: I6161fe44fb6f7cb2271620235bd87fe80ce26127

commit_message:
use rpc Connection rather than create_connection

The create_connection function in neutron.common.rpc is just an alias to
Connection. This patch switches to the later so we can remove the former
in: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560130

Change-Id: I3ebb94c00becfb2d468470260a99ac2741a7ee81

added_lines: self.conn = n_rpc.Connection()

commit_message:
Move MV history under API Microversion contrib docs

The REST API Version History was being listed in the top level
TOC for the contributor guide, causing each microversion to show
up as a separate item in the table of contents. This looks a odd
and causes a lot of scrolling to get to some of the contributor
information.

This moves the version history under the API Microversions
section so all microversion information is within on section of
the guide.

Change-Id: I74232b52088a395b618e07902427889200c2fdae

commit_message:
pep8: include no-tls-endpoints-public-ip.yaml in validation

no-tls-endpoints-public-ip.yaml is a new file that needs to be validated
among other TLS environments, so we can make sure that EndpointMap will
be constructed correctly with all needed endpoints.

Change-Id: I5e83b37d8fa757065a6dab87d6eeac1c345efd32

commit_message:
exit out w/ error message when pip fails

Change-Id: I36b0660b89d6fed4b30a6a496e38502af55a76c5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/21/561021/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: python setup.py install egg_info --egg-base $OPT_WORKDIR || { echo 'python setup.py install failed' ; exit 1; } mkdir -p .tmp EXTRAS_DIR=$(/bin/mktemp -d -p $(pwd)/.tmp) pushd $EXTRAS_DIR if [ -x "$ZUUL_CLONER" ] && [ ! -z "$ZUUL_BRANCH" ]; then else git clone git://git.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras cd tripleo-quickstart-extras fi pip install . popd pip install --no-cache-dir "${OPT_REQARGS[@]}" || { echo 'pip install failed' ; exit 1; }
deleted_lines: python setup.py install egg_info --egg-base $OPT_WORKDIR if [ -x "$ZUUL_CLONER" ] && [ ! -z "$ZUUL_BRANCH" ]; then mkdir -p .tmp EXTRAS_DIR=$(/bin/mktemp -d -p $(pwd)/.tmp) pushd $EXTRAS_DIR pip install . popd fi pip install --no-cache-dir "${OPT_REQARGS[@]}"

commit_message:
Skip service test

This commit makes service tests fail because an issue on kuryr
kubernetes when creating services using octavia without lbaasv2. [1]

This is a temporary measure to unlock the gates and will be reverted as
soon as the appropiate patches are merged [2]

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/kuryr-kubernetes/+bug/1763045
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560433/

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560946/
Change-Id: Idf55152b5f8ccc2133e272cdf9b9efd5e5ae64c9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-tempest-plugin refs/changes/41/561141/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @skip_because(bug="1763045")

commit_message:
WIP: Make placement-api run on uwsgi

Debian doesn't use Apache2, but has an init script using uwsgi
for nova-placement-api. This patch is an attempt to stop using
Apache, which binds on the same port.

Change-Id: I55e049d1483acbfd77adf81763e1048b2b036e51
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/00/561000/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $placement_service_name = 'httpd' if ($::os_package_type == 'debian') { $placement_service_name = 'nova-placement-api' } else { $placement_service_name = 'httpd' }

commit_message:
set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

Change-Id: Ief7f053de13287bc3c1032870c255be4b880d172
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/25/561025/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3[testenv:py27] basepython = python2.7

commit_message:
Update Duplicate entry exceptions to provide more information

This patchset updates the DuplicateEntry exception messages to
provide useful information about what exactly the duplicate values
are.  It also adds a test for duplicate workflows within a namespace,
and methods for testing assert error message contents.

Change-Id: I186e58e0d7c93d328070f32bd41c5ac79dcbda70
Closes-Bug: 1756443

commit_message:
Prometheus: Generate command line flags dynamically

This proposes a means for generating the command line flags for
configuring the Prometheus service via the values file instead of
templating out the command line flags used for the service. This
allows flexibility in choosing which flags and values to use when
deploying Prometheus, without needing to modify the chart itself

Change-Id: I74845b96e213403ad743724137a82ce2c78fcd1f

commit_message:
Fix bifrost CI

Bifrost's CI is broken by two items:

Ansible 2.5's pause module seems to be
more syntax strict, and we might have been
missing the pause logic all along due to the
when being down a level too far in the yaml.

Additionally, fedora core 26 support in CI
is no longer available, and as such disabling
for the time being.

This should fix CI.

Change-Id: I37df36d5f1bf13c833feda9e0a7f0a288a18a097

commit_message:
set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 specific test
environments. Set Python 2.7 as the python version to use for these
tests.

Temporarily ignore optional driver requirements for now. This will be
addressed in a later update.

Change-Id: Iea8e48b72234bb9a580f2345396cf60fe2022618

commit_message:
Switch pep8 job to python 3

pep8 under python 3 is more strict than under python 2, so to make
sure our projects meet the more strict standards we want to run the
pep8 jobs using python 3 by default.

Change-Id: If3016aef3a75281ff9edb5615bbc4575e6214e9e

commit_message:
Add keystone roles for Octavia policies

This patch adds creation of the necessary keystone roles to support
using Octavia's access policies.

Related-Bug: #1762774
Change-Id: Ib34ad49d52bb6afba6d035cf966592e0f0fd9a85

subject: lbaasv2: Fix for deployments missing the proxy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-11 14:17:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/commit/5fa133df3a5555ab68a35268a44b8fac448e7200', 'message': 'lbaasv2: Fix for deployments missing the proxy

When Octavia stopped needing neutron-lbaasv2 devstack plugin we tried it
out with success but we still kept usage the plugin so that our devstack
plugin could target older than pike.

Unfortunately during this time the proxy became unnecessary and not well
maintained and due to our gates still using it, when we tried queens
with the supported proxy less Octavia we realized that it fails.

This patch addresses it by making the existing neutronclient usage point
to the load-balancer endpoint when the proxy is not in place.

Change-Id: Iafd74f23bdf336a4d78ba4759f702cf989c8bc30

commit_message:
lbaasv2: Fix for deployments missing the proxy

When Octavia stopped needing neutron-lbaasv2 devstack plugin we tried it
out with success but we still kept usage the plugin so that our devstack
plugin could target older than pike.

Unfortunately during this time the proxy became unnecessary and not well
maintained and due to our gates still using it, when we tried queens
with the supported proxy less Octavia we realized that it fails.

This patch addresses it by making the existing neutronclient usage point
to the load-balancer endpoint when the proxy is not in place.

Change-Id: Iafd74f23bdf336a4d78ba4759f702cf989c8bc30
Closes-Bug: #1763045
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

the OpenStackClient team, so put it in the openstackclient project
group on storyboard.openstack.org.

commit_message:
Add missing Ubuntu packages

When running scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh with options set to
export BOOTSTRAP_OPTS="bootstrap_host_data_disk_device=sdb"
parted is required to cope with disk wiping and proper
partitioning. iptables are required later while configuring
vlans and bridges.

Change-Id: I2221fc63c3779358dec5edf9e2d110bc2e1528c1
(cherry picked from commit 83555059570cb5dd9d3f98e643dc04a823d5197b)

subject: Add resource-stickiness=INFINITY to VIPs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-13 06:51:51.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/pacemaker/haproxy_with_vip.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/2131880c710d04d1d6030f02f9e257bbfe14d339', 'message': 'Add resource-stickiness=INFINITY to VIPs

Right now we do not add any resource stickiness to the VIPs. This has
one consequence when we configure IHA: Namely, when a fenced compute
node comes back (i.e. it recovers), pacemaker is free to move the VIPs
around the controllers (see http://clusterlabs.org/pacemaker/doc/en-US/Pacemaker/1.1/html/Clusters_from_Scratch/_prevent_resources_from_moving_after_recovery.html)
to optimize the resource placement. We can observe the VIP moving with
the following message:
Apr 12 06:37:04 [979790] controller-1 pengine: notice: LogAction: * Move ip-10.0.0.110 ( controller-1 -> controller-0 )

This movement of the VIP is highly undesirable because in Instance HA the fence_compute agent needs to talk to keystone via the VIP, and if the VIP is on the move we might get the following errors:
Apr 12 06:37:23 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[259311] stderr: [ Starting new HTTP connection (1): 10.0.0.110 ]
Apr 12 06:37:23 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[259311] stderr: [ keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure: Unable to establish connection to http://10.0.0.110:5000 ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ REQ: curl -g -i -X GET http://10.0.0.110:5000 -H "Accept: application/json" -H "User-Agent: python-keystoneclient" ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ Starting new HTTP connection (1): 10.0.0.110 ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure: Unable to establish connection to http://10.0.0.110:5000 ]

By setting the resource-stickiness of the VIPs to INFINITY we control how strongly they prefer to stay running where they are.

Change-Id: I6862452d2250ac4c2c3e04840983510a3cd13536
Closes-Bug: #1763586
'}]
commit_message:
Add resource-stickiness=INFINITY to VIPs

Right now we do not add any resource stickiness to the VIPs. This has
one consequence when we configure IHA: Namely, when a fenced compute
node comes back (i.e. it recovers), pacemaker is free to move the VIPs
around the controllers (see http://clusterlabs.org/pacemaker/doc/en-US/Pacemaker/1.1/html/Clusters_from_Scratch/_prevent_resources_from_moving_after_recovery.html)
to optimize the resource placement. We can observe the VIP moving with
the following message:
Apr 12 06:37:04 [979790] controller-1 pengine: notice: LogAction: * Move ip-10.0.0.110 ( controller-1 -> controller-0 )

This movement of the VIP is highly undesirable because in Instance HA the fence_compute agent needs to talk to keystone via the VIP, and if the VIP is on the move we might get the following errors:
Apr 12 06:37:23 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[259311] stderr: [ Starting new HTTP connection (1): 10.0.0.110 ]
Apr 12 06:37:23 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[259311] stderr: [ keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure: Unable to establish connection to http://10.0.0.110:5000 ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ REQ: curl -g -i -X GET http://10.0.0.110:5000 -H "Accept: application/json" -H "User-Agent: python-keystoneclient" ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ Starting new HTTP connection (1): 10.0.0.110 ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure: Unable to establish connection to http://10.0.0.110:5000 ]

By setting the resource-stickiness of the VIPs to INFINITY we control how strongly they prefer to stay running where they are.

Change-Id: I6862452d2250ac4c2c3e04840983510a3cd13536
Closes-Bug: #1763586
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/36/561136/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: meta_params => 'resource-stickiness=INFINITY',
